author: Laura Stevens
title: Amazon’s Quarterly Profit Tops $1 Billion
text:
Amazon.com Inc.’s quarterly profit topped $1 billion for the first time, reflecting the company’s push to exhibit stronger fiscal discipline while simultaneously broadening its ambitions beyond online retailing.

The Seattle company’s profit more than doubled to $1.9 billion during the all-important holiday quarter, extending its streak of profitability over two and a half years. The company has long plowed most of the money it makes to build products, roll out services and construct warehouses, but it is no longer racking...
